reviews.review_msg: Just keep in mind, going into this course he will "NOT" give you any hints on potential type questions for the exams. Not a clear grading criteria. Likes to show off that he knows how to derive equations by writing them on 5 whiteboards, but not a single one in exam. The Assignments are hard, requires a lot of work above and beyond his lecture.

The class overall is not very difficult. The homework questions require some thinking, but if you refer to the lectures notes while doing them, they are manageable. There are also extra credit after every homework. IMO doing the homework also is essential for doing well in the exams. In brief: DO THE HOMEWORK, and youll enjoy this class a lot.
He seems very enthusiastic about the material but lectures and exam were not connected at all, better off reading and understanding all concepts from the book.

Lectures are irrelevant for the most part the key to them would be the last few slides that say learning objectives, study those. Read the textbook, it's absolutely necessary because the lecture notes aren't enough. Overall nice prof

Very nice teacher who seems almost overly polite and wants nothing more to share his knowledge with students.  Powerpoints were good although sometimes would focus too much on derivation understanding of the concepts was less stressed.  Tests had very little math and mainly consisted of ranking things in different orders.  Overall I would recommend
